document_data.mainbody:
owshot sat aside the Trade Way north of the Way Inn and south of Liams Hold.  It was named for its location, being a "bowshot" from the Misty Forest when the village was founded . The woods became considerably farther away as the years of logging have taken their toll.
Recently caverns have been discovered at the western edge of the hamlet. The caves maybe connected to the upper Underdark and a large vein of silver.
Bowshot had a prosperous farming community. One of the cultivated vegetables they exported to Daggerford were onions.
* The Bowshot Inn
* Andalors Mill
